result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kimberly A Hook in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Phase of NGI Court Trial. Sworn in for the Defense: Dr. Deborah Collins. Exhibit 1 received. Defense rests. State rests. Testimony closed. Cause argued. Court found the defendant was not mentally responsibile for her actions at the time of the offenses on both counts.    

The Court finds that the defendant is not a danger to himself or the community.  The Court ordered the defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Conditional Release for a period , to be determined after the court reviews the report prepared by the Wisconsin Community Services , throught  the Dept of DHS.  Review hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kimberly A Hook in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  
Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm


Plea hearing proceeded: 
As to PHASE I :            AS TO COUNT ONE AND COUNT TWO
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  

Court Vacates Jury Trial.     
Court ordered case adjourned for Court Trial ( PHASE II). 
Doctor Collins Notified and will be available for the next hearing.  
Court trial scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kimberly A Hook in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Defendant Kimberly A Hook in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctor's report finding the defendant competent to proceed at this time. All parties stipulate to the findings.   Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. Collins be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.16.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Dr. Bales report dated 9/23/2015 entered for scanning purposes

Defendant Kimberly A Hook in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

All parties in receipt of Doctor's report. NO corrections or additions.    Compentency hearing proceeded. Sworn in for the State: Dr. Courtney Endres via phone conference.  State rests. Defense rests. Testimony closed . All parties in agreement with the findings in the report. 

 The Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The proceedings are suspended.  The defendant is commited on 8-14-15 to the Department of Health and Family Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  DHFS shall designate the mental health institute.  The sheriff shall transport the defendant to and from the designated institute.  The institute shall periodically re-examine the defendant and furnish written reports to the court 3 months, 6 months and 9 months after commitment, and 30 days prior to the expiration of the commitment.
Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
  Review hearing scheduled for 11-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

All parties are in receipt of doctor's report finding the defendant not competent at this time, but likely to regain competency with treatment. Defense is challenging the report.  Court ordered a competency hearing. Defendant remains remanded and is currently in Winnebago Mental Health Inst.  Competency hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kimberly A Hook in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Defendant Kimberly A Hook in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court orders Defendant's right of substitution preserved.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
